pr_title: Start team-based exercises and create submissions

timeline.bodyText: rename username to participantIdentifier

timeline.bodyText: please add a log.info(..) statement here so that we could potentially track this in the log
timeline.author: krusche

timeline.message: Update comment to mention teams as well
Add info log when deleting all participations of team
Move teams route for students to /courses instead of /course-management
Repo export for student logins or team short names
Generalize from student to participant on StudentParticipation (WIP)
Generalize from student to participant on StudentParticipation
isEmpty instead of isNull due to Optional
isEmpty instead of isNull due to Optional
Load team students with student participation when auth check needs it to prove participation ownership

- adapt StudentParticipationRepository to find team participations
- fix broken routes to /exercises/:exerciseId/teams for file upload and text
- handle team instead of student for studentParticipation in participation component and service
Keep team queries explicit in StudentParticipationRepository and use them in ParticipationService (avoids fetching teams and students for non-team based exercises)
Handle "Not yet assigned to team" participation status
Do not allow exercise mode change after creation
Link students in team member list
Search for teams by their students + generalize participations page for team exercises
Team should always return students, even if empty
Assessment dashboards + score calculation for teams
Add id column to teams table + add update team button on team detail page
Edit and delete team from team detail view + delete confirm modals
Add mode to exercise detail pages
Do not show loading animation for team button
If there are already participations, the student must be part of a team already
Link to teams from participations table
Fix repository url for team based participations in frontend
Link name and login/short name to respective pages + adapt exercise score exports for teams
AssignedTeamId when a participation is available
Fix deleting teams with participations + only allow instructors to delete teams
Adapt repo permissions when changing team members

timeline.bodyText: Should this be handled in this PR?
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: Good question. I think adapting the complaints to teams is probably better suited to a follow-up PR since it might require some non-trivial decisions on how we want to handle complaints for team-based exercises. Also this PR is already on the larger side and since the creation of team-based exercises is still hidden for non-admin users, it is not like regular users will run into this under-construction part of the epic. I should still see about though that I deliver this within some days.
replies.author: madwau

replies.bodyText: Alright, then let's handle this in a different PR.
replies.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText:
I find this method name now misleading: It pretends to use a exercise id (as it did before), but uses an Exercise object now.
Please rename it e.g. to findOneByExerciseAndStudentLoginWithEagerSubmissionsAnyState
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: Good catch, oversight on my part. I fixed it.
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText:
I find this method name now misleading: It pretends to use a exercise id (as it did before), but uses an Exercise object now.
Same as above.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: Usage of misleading method, see ParticipationService.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: Usage of misleading method, see ParticipationService.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: Usage of misleading method, see ParticipationService.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: Usage of misleading method, see ParticipationService.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText:
Is it possible that a team has no members when this is called (e.g. all team members are removed for some reason?)?
This would cause an error here, but I don't know if that's a problem or if this is not possible.
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: Great catch. In theory it would indeed be possible that someone removed all students from a team that already has programming exercise participations before this method is called. Then this would have thrown a NoSuchElementException. I fixed it so that it uses the existing fallback correctly for empty teams.
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText: I would assume this is fine for the log, but maybe @krusche should decide that.
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: The TODO placement might have been a little misleading; it refers to the whole method and not just the log statement. But I think you are right that only @krusche has enough insight here to know how exportStudentRepositories should behave for teams. The behavior right now is that it treats teams as it would treat students (and uses the team shortName for the student login).
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText:
I find this method name now misleading: It pretends to use a exercise id (as it did before), but uses an Exercise object now.
Same as in ParticipationService.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: Usage of misleading method.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText:
I don't know if I understand this correctly:
This field can have several values for the same Exercise depending on what user is interacting with the Exercise, correct?
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: Yes, that is correct. It is a dynamically set transient property and the value depends on the logged-in user. There is some precedent for this already on the Exercise model, namely studentParticipations depend on the user as well.
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText: See comment of the field in the class Exercise.
timeline.author: sleiss

timeline.bodyText: This behaviour will be changed in a future PR, right?
timeline.author: sleiss

replies.bodyText: Yes, I think it's better to do this in a separate PR. I put it on my todo list, so it won't be forgotten.
replies.author: madwau

timeline.bodyText: Usage of misleading method.

timeline.message: Rename methods according to first argument from ExerciseId to Exercise
Set transient attribute for exercise details request
Increate test coverage for TeamResource to 100%
Fix boolean deserialization issue for assignedToTeam (needed for testing team student search)
Test assignedTeamIdOnExercise + test that starting a participations fails when no team is assigned yet
Fix small bug where students from original team cannot be added back right away when removed from pending team
Make "delete student from team" button keyboard accessible
Handle participations with no students associated gracefully
Improve search: handle "query too short" and "no results"
Team-based exercises focused client tests for exercise-details-student-actions.component.html
Responsive display when modal is too small

- server test for starting team programming exercises
- do not use team short name as user info in repoUrl for team repositories (just leave out user info segment of repoUrl for team participations, reinsert in frontend when needed)

Revert "Fix object mapper module issue"

This reverts commit d076065a

Revert "Fix object mapper module issue"

This reverts commit 3996d845
Fix test issue caused by different serializers for read/write

timeline.bodyText: Is there a typo in studentTeamOriginaRepo?

replies.bodyText: Definitely looks like a typo to me in the original studentOriginaRepo in the line above. I fixed both occurences.
replies.author: madwau

timeline.message: Fix typo in origin repo names

timeline.bodyText: I guess the variable studentId should then be renamed to participantId
timeline.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText: I guess we should update this comment
timeline.author: krusche

replies.author: krusche

timeline.bodyText:
I think there is a small logic error here. In case of a team exercise, we would like to export the repository only, if the team was mentioned in the "studentList", otherwise we would export the same repository multiple times, if the students of the same team are mentioned here.
So I would suggest we rename studentList to participantList and instructors need to refer to team short names for a team exercise and to student logins for individual exercises.
If you don't want to change this here, please add a TODO and fix it in a subsequent PR
timeline.author: krusche

replies.bodyText:
You are correct. Right now the same repository would get exported multiple times if more than one student from the same team is entered.
Your suggestion for how to handle this makes total sense. I'll include it here since it should be quick to adapt.
replies.author: madwau

replies.bodyText:
Export for individual-mode exercises:

Export for team-mode exercises:

I tested the export for individual and team exercises with a specified list of participants and without (i.e. download all).
replies.author: madwau
